text.text_translated: There are more questions about the influence of genetics on brain and language development. For example, are there genes that mutated and gave us the ability to speak? **Genes** are the instructions inside our bodies that decide how we grow. Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago, which seems to be connected with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It is too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
